experience: You and Diana Rose both know Bret Giles, Shay Pausa, and 19 others
Just finished Producing and Directing this 54 minute documentary!

We filmed it entirely in Idaho and next week we are having our Premiere in Twin Falls, Idaho. Idaho PBS has shown interest in airing it this winter and from there we are in conversation with numerous PBS stations across the country as well as here in AZ for airing this spring. It is about a 12,000 year old stone tool cache of clovis points know as the Simon Collection. I'll keep you posted on when and were it will be aired in Spring of 2018.

Litróf was created to explore creativity and aesthetic education. In 2016, Scott Marshall Brandon and I joined forces and re-created Litróf Consulting, an international consulting firm that brings to organizations the business acumen and strategic planning that leads to successful, repeatable results.
I was brought in to help get the company ready to attend an industry show as well as start a new style guide, create SEO content for the website and other projects as needed.
As a remote contractor, I continued to write articles and create copy for various marketing assets including data sheets, email and magazine (long-form) articles.Read my bylines at the link.

I like to say I’m in the business of art. I develop brands, create content strategies, solve customer problems and increase shareholder value.I create original, SEO-ranking copy for various lead generating vehicles that result in pipeline revenue. Projects I’ve worked on have generated more than $4M each, and some have lead to record numbers of webinar attendees or product demos.Copywriting projects include thought leadership whitepapers, email and nurture campaigns along with helping to identify best practices and increasing email open rates to a 2016 average of 19% (up from single digits). I create digital ads, website landing pages, feature articles, video and live-event scripts, ghostwriting and articles responding to current events.I also develop relationships with partner marketing staff; make recommendations on operational efficiency.

Hired to elevate retail brand and reach a more targeted audience, create opportunity to more easily expand nationally (in addition to current Arizona and Colorado locations). Provided full audit on existing marketing efforts; identified appropriate audience and their primary interests; created marketing strategy; created new social media strategy and content, email campaigns; managed budget. Realigned in-house marketing department to create in-house agency; adjusted staff responsibilities for efficacy and development; managed staff of 4 and external agency.

It was very rewarding to work alongside some of the most dedicated and lovely people, and to be able to make a dramatic impact in the lives of pets and their families. I volunteered photography - re-photographing animals to showcase them in their best light on the AHS website. I also created and taught a class for other volunteers so that more people could help market the animals online in a really effective way.

Experienced Marketing Professional | Branding | Content Marketing | Making the Impossible Possible
September 2, 2016, Tena managed Diana Rose directly

The usual expression is, "Jack of all trades, master of none," but that isn't the case with Diana. She is a master at many creative and marketing disciplines. From her keen eye for photography to writing and marketing strategy - Diana truly understands the "business of creative."On our team, we believe that good ideas can come from anywhere and while many of the great ideas happen to come from Diana, she is able to embrace and elevate others' ideas just as if they were her own.

Michael Ham
Visual Designer at Mozilla Coporation
June 26, 2015, Michael reported directly to Diana Rose

When an offer came along to join the team at snapfactory, the boutique agency and studio co-founded by Diane, I jumped at the opportunity without hesitation. It's rare to come across a talent like Diane – someone who is equal parts strategist, artist, and leader.Working with Diane at snapfactory was a collaborative process which focused on detail at every point in a project, from planning and concepting to delivering amazing visuals and compelling copy. Diane's unique blend of business acumen and creativity makes her uniquely suited for leading a team and championing a brand.Oh, and in addition to being a gifted photographer and savvy marketing professional, Diane makes a mean bagel.As someone who has been snapfactory's client and Diane's colleague, I can readily recommend Diane as a hard-working asset to any team.

Marketing Director at Adorama, Multi-Channel Retailer
January 13, 2015, Gvantsa worked with Diana Rose in the same group

Gvantsa is more than an exceptional marketing project manager, she’s also the heart of our marketing team. She is somehow able to manage serious organization and project execution in a chaotic environment while also lending her experience to new team members and sharing her calming and compassionate nature with other (often overwhelmed) officemates. I appreciate Gvantsa’s style - thoughtful, strategic, deadline-driven and organized. She makes it very easy to work together, and makes it easier to work with others around our company by sharing information, facilitating meetings and introductions, and really understanding the pulse of the organization. Gvantsa has marketing covered, from the big picture strategies to making the smallest details happen.

summary: What is your process to create content for your audience? I start with the end.I believe you must first consider both who the audience is and what you want them to do. It’s only by determining those end results that you can know how to begin.For about 20 years, I’ve been an accomplished creative communications professional, writer, brand & marketing strategist and producer.  I create strategies for internal and external audiences, and translate complex information into understandable, relatable and actionable content.  I’m directly experienced in technology, tourism, education, healthcare, home building, retail and fashion. I have years of brand, advertising and publicity experience (and both digital and analog portfolios to show for it.)I co-created Litróf Consulting with Scott Marshall Brandon to bring to organizations the business acumen and strategic planning that leads to successful innovation.  Litróf works with international organizations in commerce, education, medicine, and culture to help create environments where innovation can thrive and they can also deliver social good benefits. Core Strengths: Marketing and Communications Strategy, Copywriting, Brand Creation and Development, Advertising Campaign Ideation, Public Relations, Social Media, Video Concept and Scripting, Budgeting, Online and Email Marketing, Photography and Content Production, Managing Teams & Developing StaffOf the many achievements I’m proud of, one of the best for me was helping significantly increase adoptions of hard-to-adopt animals at Arizona Humane Society by volunteering photography. I also created and taught a class for other volunteers to assist the effort.
name: Diana Rose (Wallace) Brandon
title: I help people live & work better by collaborating with organizations to solve customer problems and tell their stories.
